snatools 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Delete Vertex Attributes

Source: R/vertex-attributes.R
vrt_delete_attr.Rd

Delete Vertex Attributes

vrt_delete_attr(x, ...)

# S3 method for bridge_net
vrt_delete_attr(x, ...)

# S3 method for igraph
vrt_delete_attr(x, ...)

# S3 method for network
vrt_delete_attr(x, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_graph
vrt_delete_attr(x, ...)

Arguments

x

A bridge_net, igraph, network, or tbl_graph.
...

character including the name(s) of one or more vertex attributes to delete from x.

Value

x, but with ... deleted.

See also

igraph::delete_vertex_attr()

network::delete.vertex.attribute()

Examples

library(snatools)

data(sampson_monastery)

ig <- sampson_monastery %>%
  as_igraph()

nw <- sampson_monastery %>%
  as_network()

tidy_g <- ig %>%
  tidygraph::as_tbl_graph()

sampson_monastery %>%
  vrt_delete_attr("cloisterville", "status")
#> # A directed, multiplex, 1-mode `bridge_net`.
#> # - Contains 0 loops and 0 isolates.
#> $edges # first 3 of 510
#>    .ego    .alter  weight relation time  positive_relation
#>    <.name> <.name> <dbl>  <chr>    <int> <lgl>            
#>  | Romauld Ambrose 2      liking   1     TRUE             
#>  | Romauld Peter   3      liking   1     TRUE             
#>  | Romauld Albert  1      liking   1     TRUE             
#> $vertices # first 3 of 18
#>    .name       faction 
#>    <.name>     <chr>   
#>  | Romauld     Waverers
#>  | Bonaventure Loyal   
#>  | Ambrose     Loyal   

ig %>%
  vrt_delete_attr("faction")
#> IGRAPH 1d84c89 DNW- 18 510 -- 
#> + attr: network_name (g/c), author (g/c), cloisterville (v/l), status
#> | (v/c), name (v/c), weight (e/n), relation (e/c), time (e/n),
#> | positive_relation (e/l)
#> + edges from 1d84c89 (vertex names):
#>  [1] Romauld    ->Ambrose     Romauld    ->Peter       Romauld    ->Albert     
#>  [4] Bonaventure->Romauld     Bonaventure->Victor      Bonaventure->Albert     
#>  [7] Ambrose    ->Romauld     Ambrose    ->Bonaventure Ambrose    ->Elias      
#> [10] Berthold   ->Peter       Berthold   ->Louis       Berthold   ->Gregory    
#> [13] Peter      ->Berthold    Peter      ->Hugh        Peter      ->Mark       
#> [16] Louis      ->Romauld     Louis      ->Berthold    Louis      ->John Bosco 
#> + ... omitted several edges

nw %>%
  vrt_delete_attr("cloisterville", "faction")
#>  Network attributes:
#>   vertices = 18 
#>   directed = TRUE 
#>   hyper = FALSE 
#>   loops = FALSE 
#>   multiple = TRUE 
#>   bipartite = FALSE 
#>   network_name = Crisis in the Cloister 
#>   author = Samuel F. Sampson 
#>   total edges= 510 
#>     missing edges= 0 
#>     non-missing edges= 510 
#> 
#>  Vertex attribute names: 
#>     status vertex.names 
#> 
#>  Edge attribute names: 
#>     positive_relation relation time weight 

tidy_g %>%
  vrt_delete_attr("faction", "status")
#> # A tbl_graph: 18 nodes and 510 edges
#> #
#> # A directed multigraph with 1 component
#> #
#> [90m# Node Data: 18 x 2 (active)[39m
#>   cloisterville name       
#>   [3m[90m<lgl>[39m[23m         [3m[90m<chr>[39m[23m      
#> [90m1[39m FALSE         Romauld    
#> [90m2[39m TRUE          Bonaventure
#> [90m3[39m FALSE         Ambrose    
#> [90m4[39m FALSE         Berthold   
#> [90m5[39m TRUE          Peter      
#> [90m6[39m FALSE         Louis      
#> [90m# ... with 12 more rows[39m
#> #
#> [90m# Edge Data: 510 x 6[39m
#>    from    to weight relation  time positive_relation
#>   [3m[90m<int>[39m[23m [3m[90m<int>[39m[23m  [3m[90m<dbl>[39m[23m [3m[90m<chr>[39m[23m    [3m[90m<int>[39m[23m [3m[90m<lgl>[39m[23m            
#> [90m1[39m     1     3      2 liking       1 TRUE             
#> [90m2[39m     1     5      3 liking       1 TRUE             
#> [90m3[39m     1    14      1 liking       1 TRUE             
#> [90m# ... with 507 more rows[39m
